intro: Calamintha josephi, commonly known as Alpine germander, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, often emitting a mint-like fragrance when crushed. Calamintha josephi thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
